content.webTitle: Rugby union: Tindall is still in the running

fields.headline: Tindall is still in the running
fields.bodyText: England's Mike Tindall, who is struggling to recover from a broken leg, has resumed running in training. A final call on the centre's World Cup prospects will be made at the weekend. Mark Cueto, who has a groin injury, Peter Richards, suffering a back problem, and Tom Rees (hamstring) should resume training on Monday. The wing David Strettle, however, had surgery yesterday to insert a screw into the fifth metatarsal bone of his left foot. He will be out for three months. "I feel desperately sorry for David as I'm sure he would have made a big contribution to our World Cup campaign," said the head coach, Brian Ashton.
